  3. Skillet-Steamed Haricots Verts

Skillet-Steamed Haricots Verts

Servings: 4

Time: 15 minutes

Ingredients

  • 12 ounces haricots verts, trimmed
  • ¼ cup water
  • ¼ teaspoon table salt
  • 1 tablespoon unsalted butter, cut into 4 pieces
  • 1 tablespoon minced shallot

Equipment

  • Lids for 12-inch Skillets
  • 12-Inch Stainless-Steel Skillets

Recipe Notes

  1. We developed this recipe with beans that were about ¼ inch wide. If your haricots verts are skinnier, decrease the water to 3 tablespoons and decrease the covered cooking time to 2 minutes.

Instructions

  1. Arrange haricots verts in even layer in 12-inch skillet. Add water and sprinkle evenly with salt. Cook over medium-high heat until water is sizzling. Cover and continue to cook until beans are bright green and crisp-tender, about 3 minutes longer, tossing beans twice during cooking. Reduce heat to medium. Add butter and shallot and continue to cook, uncovered, tossing beans frequently, until water has evaporated, about 1 minute longer. Season with salt to taste, and serve.
